H0.text: Denmark has a single land border; with which country. Germany

A4.text: It includes one of Denmark's two land borders (the other being the border with Canada on Hans Island).

A5.text: The Denmarkâ€“Germany border is a land and maritime border between the modern countries of Denmark and Germany.

A6.text: It shares a border of 68 kilometres (42 mi) with Germany to the south.

A7.text: It is the southernmost of the Scandinavian countries, lying southwest of Sweden, south of Norway, and north of Germany, with which it shares a short border.

A8.text: The treaty established the Danish border at the Eider River.

A9.text: Schleswig-Holstein borders Denmark (Southern Denmark) to the north.
